member.name: T:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMData`1
member.summary: A class to hold DICOM data. DICOM data is unique in that it can be a single value, multiple values and null. This class tries to encapsulate those attributes while maintaining a flexible programming interface.

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMData`1.#ctor
member.summary: The constructor which ininitializes the underlying enumerable collection

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMData`1.CreateFromSingle(`0)
member.summary: Creates a new DICOM Data object from a single data value
member.param: the data value from which to initialize the DICOM Data object

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMData`1.CreateFromArray(`0[])
member.summary: Creates a new DICOM Data object from an array of data
member.param: the data array from which to initialize the DICOM Data object

member.name: P:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMData`1.SingleValue
member.summary: Gets and sets a single value for the data of the DICOM element. If the collection contains has more than one data element, only the first is returned. If setting a value, the data is cleared and only a single entry is saved.

member.name: P:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMData`1.MultipicityValue
member.summary: A list of the data within the element. This is designed to be accomodate the multiplicity aspect of DICOM data

member.name: T:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMForge
member.summary: Class for creating strongly typed elements on the fly

member.name: T:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject
member.summary: The DICOM object is a container for DICOM elements. It contains methods for finding elements easily from within the structure.

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor no parameters

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{EvilDICOM.Core.Interfaces.IDICOMElement})
member.summary: Contructor with elements
member.param: a list of elements to be included in the object

member.summary: Adds an element to the DICOM object
member.param: a DICOM element to be added

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.TryGetDataValue``1(EvilDICOM.Core.Element.Tag,System.Object)
member.summary: Searches for a specific element. If it is found, it returns the data from the element. Otherwise, it will return a provided default value for the element.
member.typeparam: the type of data to return
member.param: the tag of the element containing the data
the default value to return if the element is not found

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.TrySetDataValue``1(EvilDICOM.Core.Element.Tag,``0)
member.summary: Searches for a specific element (first instance). If it is found, it sets the data for this element and returns true, otherwise returns false;
member.typeparam: the type of data to return
member.param: the tag of the element containing the data
the data to set in this element
member.returns: a boolean indicating whether or not the operation was successful

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.TrySetDataValue``1(EvilDICOM.Core.Element.Tag,System.Collections.Generic.List{``0})
member.summary: Searches for a specific element (first instance). If it is found, it sets the data for this element and returns true, otherwise returns false;
member.typeparam: the type of data to return
member.param: the tag of the element containing the data
the data to set in this element
member.returns: a boolean indicating whether or not the operation was successful

member.summary: Finds all DICOM elements that match a VR type

member.returns: a list of all elements that meet the search criteria

member.summary: Returns elements of a certain tag that are of the unknown VR type (because they are not in the DICOM dictionary) and reads them as the specified VR type
member.typeparam: the VR type to read as
member.param: the tag of this element
member.returns: the unknown elements strongly typed to T

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.GetUnknownTagAs``1(System.String)
member.summary: Returns elements of a certain tag that are of the unknown VR type (because they are not in the DICOM dictionary) and reads them as the specified VR type
member.typeparam: the VR type to read as
member.param: the tag of this element
member.returns: the unknown elements strongly typed to T

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindAll``1
member.summary: Finds all DICOM elements that match an element type
member.typeparam: the DICOM element class that is being filtered and returned
member.returns: a list of all elements that are strongly typed

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindAll(System.String)
member.summary: Finds all DICOM elements that match a certain tag
member.param: the tag to find
member.returns: a list of all elements that meet the search criteria

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindAll(EvilDICOM.Core.Element.Tag)
member.summary: Finds all DICOM elements that match a certain tag
member.param: the tag to find
member.returns: a list of all elements that meet the search criteria

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindAll(System.String[])
member.summary: Finds all DICOM elements that are embedded in the DICOM structure in some particular location. This location is defined by descending tags from the outer most elements to the element. It is not necessary to include every tag in the descending "treelike" structure. Branches can be skipped.
member.param: a string array containing in order the tags from the outer most elements to the element being searched for
member.returns: a list of all elements that meet the search criteria

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindAll(EvilDICOM.Core.Element.Tag[])
member.summary: Finds all DICOM elements that are embedded in the DICOM structure in some particular location. This location is defined by descending tags from the outer most elements to the element. It is not necessary to include every tag in the descending "treelike" structure. Branches can be skipped.
member.param: a tag array containing in order the tags from the outer most elements to the element being searched for
member.returns: a list of all elements that meet the search criteria

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindFirst(System.String)
member.summary: Finds the first element in the entire DICOM structure that has a certain tag
member.param: the tag to be searched
member.returns: one single DICOM element that is first occurence of the tag in the structure

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindFirst(EvilDICOM.Core.Element.Tag)
member.summary: Finds the first element in the entire DICOM structure that has a certain tag
member.param: the tag to be searched
member.returns: one single DICOM element that is first occurence of the tag in the structure

member.summary: Removes the element with the tag from the DICOM object

member.summary: Removes the element with the tag from the DICOM object
member.param: the tag of the element to be removed

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.Replace``1(EvilDICOM.Core.Element.AbstractElement{``0})
member.summary: Replaces a current instance of the DICOM element in the DICOM object. If the object does not exist, this method exits. For this scenario, please use ReplaceOrAdd().
member.typeparam: the type of the data the element holds (eg. double[], int, DataTime, etc)
member.param: the instance of the element
member.returns: bool indicating whether or not the element was replaced

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.Replace(EvilDICOM.Core.Interfaces.IDICOMElement)
member.summary: Replaces the underlying DICOM element with input DICOM element of the same tag
member.param: the new DICOM element
member.returns: whether or not the operation was successful

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.ReplaceOrAdd``1(EvilDICOM.Core.Element.AbstractElement{``0})
member.summary: Replaces a current instance of the DICOM element in the DICOM object. If the object does not exist, this method will add it to the object.
member.typeparam: the type of the data the element holds (eg. double[], int, DataTime, etc)
member.param: the instance of the element

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.Dictionaries.VRDictionary.GetEncodingFromVR(EvilDICOM.Core.Enums.VR)
member.summary: Determines the encoding, meaning how many bytes to write the VR and length parameters, from a VR type. Options are explicit long (8 bytes), explicit short (4 bytes), or implicit (4 bytes). In Evil DICOM, the null VR is used to represent an unknown VR (before dictionary lookup) that is implicitly encoded.
member.param: the VR type
member.returns: the encoding method for this type
